trial_identification.studytitle: Probiotics in the management of eczema
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Double-Blind, Randomised, Placebo controlled study to identify markers for the differential response of children with eczema following treatment with probiotics.

interventions.interventions: Children aged 6 month to 12 years with eczema (Scorad of greater than 15) given lactobillus GG 3x10e8 to 1x10e9 cfu twice daily for 8 weeks observation.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at week 0, week 8 and week 16.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Gut permeability using intestinal sugar permeability test.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: All secondary outcomes are measured at: subject commencement; at 2 months (treatment completion) and at 4 months (subject completion).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: IL2, TNFa, IFNg, IL4, IL5, IL10, TGFb.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Eczema - SCORAD of 15 or greaterGuardian's proficient in EnglishNot previously actively treated with probiotics for eczema. No current chronic illness other than asthma, allergic, rhinitis or food allergy.

trial_design.concealment: Numbered packets of sealed probiotic/placebo capsules visually identical in all respects.
trial_design.sequence: Random allocation was generated using a computer software program (http://www.randomization.com). 1:1 randomisation was stratified in blocks.
